We are excited to announce our partnership with Andrew Ng and @deeplearningai.bsky.social!

Our advocacy team @willkurt.bsky.social and @cameron.pfiffer.org  created a course on building AI systems using structured output from LLMs.

Oh, and it‚Äôs free.

Oh wow. So tailscale made an announcement on April Fools' Day announcing that they had ported tailscale to Plan9, which they knew would be taken as a joke, but the joke was that they had actually really done it, which was no simple effort, required getting numerous patches into the Plan9 kernel

and I think you need to pull "recommended DID config" somewhere in the process and update the DID doc with that; that is what has PDS generate keys for account locally, then you register the pub key part in DID doc
has anyone tried and documented what it's like to recover and migrate an account that was taken down by its pds

- have control of identity (DID) ahead of time
- create account w/ existing DID on new PDS: provide signed PLC proof or point did:web there (IIRC)
- maybe mark new account as deactivated (if it isn't)
- importRepo and importBlob
- if PLC, actually update DID, via PDS
- mark new account as active

- have control of identity (DID) ahead of time
- create account w/ existing DID on new PDS: provide signed PLC proof or point did:web there (IIRC)
- maybe mark new account as deactivated (if it isn't)
- importRepo and importBlob
- if PLC, actually update DID, via PDS
- mark new account as active
has anyone tried and documented what it's like to recover and migrate an account that was taken down by its pds

- importRepo on new pds
- update did doc using like boat
should be all?

record.text:
Earnestly posting on April Fools'. Here's hoping that 2025 brings first-class support for communities on AT Protocol:
- I wanna see delegated moderation (opt to have a mod service apply labels under a post + control replies)
- Community verification (not just blue checks)
- Badges as gifts + more

value.text: They tested Google Gemini 2.5 Pro on the same test, and it performed really well. This chart provides some perspective.

You‚Äôve probably heard about how AI/LLMs can solve Math Olympiad problems ( deepmind.google/discover/blo... ).

So naturally, some people put it to the test ‚Äî hours after the 2025 US Math Olympiad problems were released.

The result: They all sucked!

external.description: Decent USAMO performance may be closer than headline results suggest
external.title: Coaxing USAMO Proofs From o3-mini-high

record.text: This is an interesting deep dive into the paper finding that LLMs wasn't able to solve any problems in the current Math Olympiad, suggesting that the o3-mini-high is closer to the answers than the headlines have suggested (though it still doesn't get them right). lemmata.substack.com/p/coaxing-us...

external.title: Coaxing USAMO Proofs From o3-mini-high

record.text: To be clear: the movies/shows themselves are fine, high quality. It's "casting" them from the computer to the TV where the quality is lost. I've not found a good solution for that bit.

I have a question: why is the interface for streaming TV so slow and buggy and ugly, like the internet in 2003? 

I have extremely fast internet service in my home, with a wifi router right next to the TV, and the shit is just sloooow. And the layout is awful. How is this not a solved problem?

Yeah it takes some work to get a good setup but there are great open source solutions. Surprised about quality though ‚Äî usually torrents get you better quality than streaming actually. Even streaming websites like netmovies.to are close in quality nowadays.
ah i see, i don't use TikTok but i have heard about them pivoting to pushing products through video. yeah that would be a big threat to Amazon.

images.alt:
Then in late 2023, billionaire hedge fund legend Ray Dalio captured the Zeitgeist precisely, stating simply that private finance would only pony up for the clean-energy transition if the returns were worthwhile. "You have to make it profitable," he said at the COP28
summit in Dubai. For now, most US banks appear unconvinced that it will be
profitable. "Wall Street is basically saying to the sustainability community: 'You promised us higher returns as well as positive impacts. You've had five years, it hasn't worked, let's move on'," said Karl Pettersen, the former chief sustainability officer for the Americas at Societe
Generale SA.

record.text:
BREAKING üì¢: BANKS WILLING TO MAKE PARTS OF OUR PLANET UNINHABITABLE AND KILL BILLIONS OF PEOPLE BECAUSE THE CLEAN-ENERGY TRANSITION ISN'T PROFITABLE!

(Haha, just kidding. That's not news. That's been the major problem with solving #ClimateChange under capitalism all along.)

images.alt:
Then in late 2023, billionaire hedge fund legend Ray Dalio captured the Zeitgeist precisely, stating simply that private finance would only pony up for the clean-energy transition if the returns were worthwhile. "You have to make it profitable," he said at the COP28
summit in Dubai. For now, most US banks appear unconvinced that it will be
profitable. "Wall Street is basically saying to the sustainability community: 'You promised us higher returns as well as positive impacts. You've had five years, it hasn't worked, let's move on'," said Karl Pettersen, the former chief sustainability officer for the Americas at Societe
Generale SA.
